meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being prodigal; wasteful extravagance.
meanings.sent1: Her prodigalities with money left her in debt.
meanings.sent2: His prodigalities with resources led to shortages for others.
meanings.sent3: The prodigalities of the party planner resulted in a grand but over-budget event.
meanings.sent4: The prodigalities of nature in creating colorful sunsets never cease to amaze me.
meanings.sent5: The prodigalities of the wealthy heiress were the talk of the town.

meanings.sent1: The extravagant wedding was a prodigality that impressed all the guests.
meanings.sent2: The prodigality of fireworks on New Year's Eve lit up the sky.
meanings.sent3: The prodigality of gifts at the office party was unexpected but appreciated.
meanings.sent4: The prodigality of emotions in the movie scene brought tears to the audience's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The prodigality of colors in the painting made it a masterpiece.
